name: Chelsea Pines Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My bf and i stayed in dec last year and was very happy with everything apart from Housekeeping as our Deluxe room was only cleaned twice in a week.
reviews.title: Would Return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The other problem was the noise if you stay on the ground floor,we had the Albert Finney room next to the Kitchen and the staff are very noisy at midnight banging plates and getting breakfast ready and then again each morning was noisy.
reviews.title: Brilliant!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The room was clean shabby chic. Bathroom was boiling all the time but clean and nice.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location, lovely breakfast

likes.liked: — Quirky, individually decorated rooms, great breakfasts and helpful staff
likes.disliked: — The stairs - but we knew they would be there when we booked!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice tv
reviews.title: A little rough round the edges but charming with it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: nice wardrobe but small and with all our shopping we soon packed the room full of all those bargains.
reviews.title: Great location & value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved our stay in the Chelsea Pines Inn. It is in a convenient part of town (on 14th Street between 8th and 9th Aves) within walking distance of Soho, Greenwich Village etc and very close to a subway stop. The hotel itself is clean and our room (the Ann-Margret room) had everything we needed: safe, ironing board, aircon, ipod charger etc. The staff were friendly and helpful, and the complimentary breakfast was a bonus. The only downside was the staircase - be prepared to trudge up the stairs with your luggage unless you request & pay more for a lower floor! Overall though we had a great stay for the price, and would stop here again.
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is amazing. We just stayed in the Tony Curtis room. It had a bathroom and was very clean and wonderful. The directions to and from the Inn were helpful and it's centrally located and easy to get to. I found all the staff friendly and helpful. We had a lot of great recommendations for restaurants and things to do. The continental breakfast was a life-saver and very hearty and good. The rooms are small, but we didn't mind that. They were really clean, however, and there was air conditioning that worked well along with big windows that opened. Our room was on the 2nd floor in the back and really perfect. We had a view of the garden and it was quiet and really wonderful. We were sad to come home! We'll definately return again.
reviews.title: Perfect Value Perfect Place

likes.disliked: — No Internet Access, No towel hooks in bathroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is such good value and much better than the traditional tourist hotels. The location is excellent and you actually feel that you are staying in the real NY. The rooms were spotless and very comfortable and the staff were very friendly and helpful. One minor complaint was a lack of breakfast one morning but this is easily forgiven considering the selection every other day. I highly recommend this to anyone who wants to stay in a small comfortable hotel at a great value price.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel in the Heart of The City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: CPI is my favorite inn in NYC. Everyone is welcome and the diversity of visitors having morning coffee in the breakfast room can be as interactive of an event as you want -- there's no forcing of dialogue as in some B&Bs. Fresh pastry and bagels are brought in every morning and it's well attended to by staff; therefore there aren't crumbs, banana peels, and used mugs ever competing for space at a table.
reviews.title: A Bargain at Twice the Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The owner, Jay, even makes fresh bread every morning.
reviews.title: Excellent location, good value, neutral service

likes.disliked: — a few elements of the service, cramped bathroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a short break and I would highly recommend it. The complimentry brekkie in the morning is a nice touch and a great way to mingle with the other travellers.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: Its not as central as you would like if you are looking to be in the middle of it all. But it has an underground station just on the corner so your set for transport.
reviews.title: So pleased I stayed here

likes.liked: — friendliness of the staff that I met that were so accomodating.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel itself is lovely the rooms are snug but clean. The guy on reception his name was Rickie Poe, hope I have the spelling right was a real character so friendly and was great for information, he really made our stay in the little jewel called Chelsea Pines well worth it.
reviews.title: would not again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for 3 nights in March & booked this hotel after reading the positive reports on Trip. I was travelling alone & had friends staying in a nearby hotel.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have asked permission of those named below to include them by name.
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ideal location, very very close to subway station, breakfast provided for free, room very small but doable for a few nights, and to be expected from new york. Staff very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008
reviews.text: NYC - thought I'd hate it. Went with my wife for a gallery opening.
reviews.title: It was GREAT!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: surprisingly, the city was good. The hotel was great. very accommating, helpful, close to subway + galleries+ good restrauants, etc.
reviews.title: What a delight!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we go back, we'll stay here again.
reviews.title: Good location; value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: We stayed nine nights at Chelsea Pines, so we had ample opportunity to experience the many facets of hotel life. The quiet, pleasant, respectful atmosphere of the hotel made it a nice place to "come home to." With excellent access to all lines on the subway, Broadway and the Financial District are no more than 15 minutes away. Two blocks away on 9th Ave. are many of the hottest night spots in the city, but Chelsea Pines remains a calm amidst the storm. We loved the neighborhood away from the roaring madness of Times Square, but with easy access if we chose to go there.
reviews.title: Home away from home at the Chelsea Pines Inn

likes.liked: — small scale homey hotel with great staff and location

aka: Chelsea Pines Hotel New York City
description: New York City is one of the most interesting, exciting, and diverse cities in the world. There are hundreds of places to see live theater, shop for almost anything, eat food from almost anywhere, visit some of the world's best museums, see fabulous sights, or just have fun, and the newly renovated Chelsea Pines Inn puts you in the center of it all.
